data.title: College feel at the coffee shop
data.text: It was homecoming weekend at Indiana and the store had a mixture of students, professors and alumni.  A beautiful fall day and after a tour of the campus a nice spot for coffee.

data.title: pricy food, crowded, but good service
data.text: this is a very popular SB locale that tends to get overwhelmed quickly. I wish they had more staff. The lines can be long but move reasonably fast. Seating looks like it could be a problem but I nearly always go there for takeout. My colleagues and students always want to hold meetings here but the seating availability is too iffy for me to recommend this location for meetings. Cheerful student service, very pleasant. And as always, Starbucks charges an arm and a leg for food or coffee, which is why I usually make my own at home!!

data.title: Burned Coffee Taste and Lots of those Creepy Hipster Beards
data.text: Starbucks coffee tastes burnt and is overpriced, plus you have to sit there and listen to hipsters talk about their limited world views. Meh. I recommend a local coffee house over a Starbucks any day and there are a couple of very good ones within five blocks of this place.

data.title: Fast, efficient and they brew decaf.
data.text: I stop here a couple of times or more each week. I do enjoy the coffee and the staff is nice and usually fast.

data.title: You can do so much better within walking distance
data.text: Its Starbucks!  What are you doing going to Starbucks when there are so many local and amazing coffee shops within walking distance?  If you like the burnt coffee thing try Runcible Spoon or Pour House or even Soma.  If you like it smooth and not bitter try Bloomingfoods, or Blue Boy, or Farm.

data.title: Predictably Bitter
data.text: The coffee simply is not good.  It's actively bad.  I understand that they are trying to be consistent across a million branches, but if the price of consistency is consistently horrible coffee, then maybe consistency shouldn't be such a cherished goal.

data.title: Best one in town
data.text: Ok, everyone has a Starbucks that they prefer, but as a 2-3 time per day customer, often ordering for multiple people, this is the only one in town that has never made a mistake & in fact if I get a botched drink at another Starbucks, I often bring it by here & they fix me another for free.  Only downfall is parking.

data.title: Well done!
data.text: Had a "legendary" Starbucks experience at this site.  The coffee was very good; the setting was excellent.  This store is built into an old classic building that fits with the University setting.  A display on one wall illustrates significant locations and events related to "Breaking Away".  Other graphic displays related to coffee fill the high wall behind the counter.  Lots of room for students with laptops and lattes.
